item.title: Critical PHP RCE vulnerability mass exploited in new attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Threat intelligence company GreyNoise warns that a critical PHP remote code execution vulnerability that impacts Windows systems is now under mass exploitation. [...]

item.title: The AI race: Dark AI is in the lead, but good AI is catching up
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Acronis
item.description: Cybercriminals are using AI for help in planning and conducting cyberattacks—but cybersecurity vendors are fighting back. Learn from Acronis Threat Research Unit about how AI-powered security solutions are closing the gap in the battle against AI-driven cyber threats. [...]

item.title: PowerSchool previously hacked in August, months before data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: PowerSchool has published a long-awaited CrowdStrike investigation into its massive December 2024 data breach, which determined that the company was previously hacked over 4 months earlier, in August, and then again in September. [...]

item.title: CISA tags critical Ivanti EPM flaws as actively exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their networks against attacks exploiting three critical vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) appliances. [...]

item.title: X hit by 'massive cyberattack' amid Dark Storm's DDoS claims
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Dark Storm hacktivist group claims to be behind DDoS attacks causing multiple X worldwide outages on Monday, leading the company to enable DDoS protections from Cloudflare. [...]

item.title: US govt says Americans lost record $12.5 billion to fraud in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) said today that Americans lost a record $12.5 billion to fraud last year, a 25% increase over the previous year. [...]

item.title: Microsoft shares guidance on upcoming Publisher deprecation
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft has published guidance for users of Microsoft Publisher as it will no longer be supported after October 2026 and removed from Microsoft 365. [...]

item.title: FTC will send $25.5 million to victims of tech support scams
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Later this week, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) will start distributing over $25.5 million in refunds to those misled by tech support companies Restoro and Reimage's scare tactics. [...]

item.title: Swiss critical sector faces new 24-hour cyberattack reporting rule
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Switzerland's National Cybersecurity Centre (NCSC) has announced a new reporting obligation for critical infrastructure organizations in the country, requiring them to report cyberattacks to the agency within 24 hours of their discovery. [...]

item.title: Google paid $12 million in bug bounties last year to security researchers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google paid almost $12 million in bug bounty rewards to 660 security researchers who reported security bugs through the company's Vulnerability Reward Program (VRP) in 2024. [...]

item.title: Quantum leap: Passwords in the new era of computing security
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Quantum computing threatens to break traditional encryption, putting sensitive data at risk. Learn more from Specops Software about the risks of quantum computing and how to prepare for them. [...]

item.title: Microsoft lifts Windows 11 update block for some AutoCAD users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has removed a compatibility hold that prevented some AutoCAD users from installing the Windows 11 2024 Update due to launch and crash issues. [...]

item.title: US cities warn of wave of unpaid parking phishing texts
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: US cities are warning of an ongoing mobile phishing campaign pretending to be texts from the city's parking violation departments about unpaid parking invoices, that if unpaid, will incur an additional $35 fine per day. [...]
